funcatron.intf

Interface OperationProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    OrderedProvider

    public interface OperationProvider
extends OrderedProvider
    Install an operation in the current context.

    What's an Operation? It's a way that the Func Runner communicates with the Func Bundle.

    What kind of operation would one create or override?

    The prototypical operation is "getSwagger". By default, the Swagger file is stored in the funcatron.yml or funcatron.json, but we may want to supply the Swagger information by looking through the Spring Boot annotations instead and get the Swagger info from Spring.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Install an operation.

      • Methods inherited from interface funcatron.intf.OrderedProvider

        order

    • Method Detail

      • installOperation

        void installOperation(BiFunction<String,BiFunction<Map<Object,Object>,Logger,Object>,Void> addOperation,
                      Function<String,BiFunction<Map<Object,Object>,Logger,Object>> getOperation,
                      Function<Function<Logger,Void>,Void> addEndOfLife,
                      ClassLoader classLoader,
                      Logger logger)
        Install an operation.
        Parameters:
        addOperation - a function to add a named operation. A named function takes a map, logger, and returns something. This function takes the name of the operation and the operation.
        getOperation - get a named operation, or null if the operation doesn't exist.
        addEndOfLife - Add a function at the end of life. If there's anything allocated by the installation of the operation (like creating a JDBC pool), then the operation should be released by the end of life function.
        classLoader - the ClassLoader for the Func Bundle
        logger - the Logger
